template_body.description: Structure containing the template body. The template content must use the yaml syntax.

template_url.description: Location of a file containing the template body.

acl.description: The canned ACL to apply. Defaults to "private".

bucket.description: The name of the bucket. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name.

bucket_prefix.description: Creates a unique bucket name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with bucket.

cors_rule.description: A rule of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (documented below).

force_destroy.description: A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the bucket so that the bucket can be destroyed without error. These objects are not recoverable.

lifecycle_rule.description: A configuration of object lifecycle management (documented below).

logging.description: A settings of bucket logging (documented below).

policy.description: A valid bucket policy JSON document. Note that if the policy document is not specific enough (but still valid), Terraform may view the policy as constantly changing in a terraform plan. In this case, please make sure you use the verbose/specific version of the policy.

region.description: If specified, the AWS region this bucket should reside in. Otherwise, the region used by the callee.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the bucket.

acl.description: The canned ACL to apply. Defaults to "private".

bucket.description: The name of the bucket to put the file in.

cache_control.description: Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain Read w3c cache_control for further details.

content.description: The literal content being uploaded to the bucket.

content_disposition.description: Specifies presentational information for the object. Read wc3 content_disposition for further information.

content_encoding.description: Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field. Read w3c content encoding for further information.

content_language.description: The language the content is in e.g. en-US or en-GB.

content_type.description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data, e.g. application/octet-stream. All Valid MIME Types are valid for this input.

etag.description: Used to trigger updates. The only meaningful value is ${md5(file("path/to/file"))}.

key.description: The name of the object once it is in the bucket.

server_side_encryption.description: Specifies server-side encryption of the object in S3. Valid values are "AES256" and "aws:kms".

source.description: The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the object.

website_redirect.description: Specifies a target URL for website redirect.

bucket.description: The name of the bucket to which to apply the policy.

access_level.description: The access level of the shared file system. Changing this will create a new access rule.

access_to.description: The access that the back end grants or denies. Changing this will create a new access rule

access_type.description: The type of the share access rule. Changing this will create a new access rule.

availability_zone.description: The availability zone name.Changing this parameter will create a new resource.

is_public.description: The level of visibility for the shared file system.

metadata.description: Metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of strings.Changing this will create a new resource.

name.description: The name of the shared file system.

share_proto.description: The protocol for sharing file systems. The default value is NFS.

size.description: The size (GB) of the shared file system.

owner.description: Project ID of the topic creator.

protocol.description: Protocol of the message endpoint. Currently, email,

remark.description: Remark information. The remarks must be a UTF-8-coded

subscription_urn.description: Resource identifier of a subscription, which

topic_urn.description: Resource identifier of a topic, which is unique.

region.description: The region in which to create the eip. If omitted,

accept.description: - Whether or not to accept the peering request. Defaults to false.

vpc_peering_connection_id.description: - The VPC Peering Connection ID to manage. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection accepter.

name.description: - Specifies the name of the VPC peering connection. The value can contain 1 to 64 characters.

peer_tenant_id.description: - Specified the Tenant Id of the accepter tenant. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection.

peer_vpc_id.description: - Specifies the VPC ID of the accepter tenant. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection.

vpc_id.description: - Specifies the ID of a VPC involved in a VPC peering connection. Changing this creates a new VPC peering connection.

destination.description: - Specifies the destination IP address or CIDR block. Changing this creates a new Route.

nexthop.description: - Specifies the next hop. If the route type is peering, enter the VPC peering connection ID. Changing this creates a new Route.

tenant_id.description: - Specifies the tenant ID. Only the administrator can specify the tenant ID of other tenant. Changing this creates a new Route.

type.description: - Specifies the route type. Currently, the value can only be peering. Changing this creates a new Route.

vpc_id.description: - Specifies the VPC for which a route is to be added. Changing this creates a new Route.

cidr.description: The range of available subnets in the VPC. The value ranges from 10.0.0.0/8 to 10.255.255.0/24, 172.16.0.0/12 to 172.31.255.0/24, or 192.168.0.0/16 to 192.168.255.0/24.

name.description: The name of the VPC. The name must be unique for a tenant. The value is a string of no more than 64 characters and can contain digits, letters, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). Changing this updates the name of the existing VPC.

region.description: The region in which to obtain the V1 VPC client. A VPC client is needed to create a VPC. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new VPC.
